title: Age of Empires II: HD Edition
notes:
Had to employ two workarounds:
1. Rename 'AoK HD.exe' into 'Launcher.exe'
2. Copy d3dx9 files (D3DCompiler_43.dll, d3dcsx_43.dll, d3dx9_43.dll) from the D3D9_DLLBACKUP directory to Age2HD root.
The second one was needed in order to launch a map, as otherwise it would fail on texture load (Age2HD/resources/_common/terrain/water/normal0.png). The wine-supplied d3dx9_43.dll is incomplete.

title: Age of Empires II: HD Edition
notes: Just crashes.

title: Age of Empires II: HD Edition
notes: Use the mentioned workaround (rename AoK HD.exe to Launcher.exe). Forrest Nothing mods are extremely slow, to the point of being unplayable. x256 and x10 worked just fine. Normal single player works fine. Haven't tested online yet, since I don't want to cause issues to other players if my computer becomes slow.

title: Age of Empires II: HD Edition
notes: Had to rename AoK HD.exe Launcher.exe. Warning! Earned Achievements disappeared from Steam once the game ran. Achievements don't seem to pop in Linux, but running the game from Windows and earning a new achievement brought most of them back, with a fresh date/timestamp.

title: Age of Empires II HD

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) UHD Graphics 620 (Kabylake GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
notes: Upgrading previous Silver rating to Gold. Game launch requires launcher renaming. After disabling some graphics functions in the ingame options (Vsync, 3d water, antialias shadows), the framerate is equivalent to Windows with those options enabled. The higher framerate helps with the mouse click&drag delay - although it's still present if the mouse is moved very quickly, it's definitely usable now.
